Trial_Design.evidence: This is a double blind, prospective randomized controlled trial

Participants.evidence: including patients aged ≥65 years ( n = 195) admitted for routine cardiac surgery with cardiopulmonary bypass

Intervention.evidence: Patients in the study group received Ringer’s acetate 1000 mL + 400 mL Mannitol (60 g) + sodium chloride 40 mL (160 mmol) and heparin 2 mL (10 000 IU) 966 mOsmol ( n = 98), while patients in the control group received Ringer’s acetate 1400 mL + heparin 2 mL (10 000 IU), 388 mOsmol ( n = 97) as pump prime

Objective.evidence: The study objective was to investigate whether a Ringer’s acetate based priming solution with addition of Mannitol and sodium concentrate increases the risk of cardiac surgery associated kidney injury (CSA-AKI).

Method_Outcome.evidence: Acute kidney injury was analysed based on the Kidney Disease Improving Outcomes (KDIGO 1-3) definition.

Blinding.evidence: This is a double blind, prospective randomized controlled trial

Number_Analysed.evidence: Six patients in the Ringer and five patients in the Mannitol group developed CSA-AKI (KDIGO 1-3)

Result_Outcome.evidence: The overall incidence of CSA-AKI (KDIGO stage 1) was 2.6% on day 1 in the ICU and 5.6% on day 3, postoperatively.

Harms.evidence: The overall incidence of CSA-AKI (KDIGO stage 1) was 2.6% on day 1 in the ICU and 5.6% on day 3, postoperatively.
